v.v: For I am filled with troubles,
People treat me like those who go down into the pit;
I am abandoned among the dead;
You place me in the lowest part of the pit,
Your wrath lies heavy on me,
Because of you, my acquaintances avoid me.
My eyes grow weary from trouble;
Will you do wonders for the dead?
Will your covenant faithfulness be proclaimed in the grave,
Will your wonderful deeds be known in the darkness,
But I cry to you, Yahweh;
Yahweh, why do you reject me?
I have always been afflicted and on the verge of death since my youth.
Your angry actions have passed over me,
They surround me like water all the day long;
You have removed every friend and acquaintance from me.

v: I cry out day and night before you.
pay attention to my cry.
and my life has reached Sheol.
I am a man with no strength.
I am like the dead who lie in the grave,
about whom you care no more
because they are cut off from your power.
in the dark and deep places.
and all your waves crash over me.
You have made me a shocking sight to them.
I am hemmed in and I cannot escape.
All day long I call out to you, Yahweh;
I spread out my hands to you.
Will those who have died rise and praise you?
your loyalty in the place of the dead?
or your righteousness in the place of forgetfulness?
in the morning my prayer comes before you.
Why do you hide your face from me?
I have suffered from your terrors; I am in despair.
and your terrifying deeds have annihilated me.
they have all encircled me.
My only acquaintance is the darkness.
